Function Documentation

int rbxNexway_getName (  char *  name,
int  maxLen,
int *  retLen
) 
 

Gets the Nexway's name.

Parameters:
[out] name pointer to a user buffer that receives the string; or NULL to get the required buffer length
[in] maxLen length of user buffer
[out] retLen pointer to an int that receives the actual number of characters copied or the required buffer length (if user buffer is NULL);
this paramater can be NULL only if the user buffer is not NULL;
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
Fetching Strings

int rbxNexway_createNexusConnection (  const char *  hostName,
int *  nexusHandle
) 
 

Creates a NexusConnectin object with the specified host name and the default port number.

The newly-created NexusConnection is initially not connected to the specified host. You must call rbxNexusConnection_connect() to establish the connection.

Parameters:
hostName host name; may be an IP address, a host name, or 'localhost'
nexusHandle pointer to an int that receives a handle to the new, un-connected NexusConnection object
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexway_createNexusConnectionEx (  const char *  hostName,
int  port,
int *  nexusHandle
) 
 

Creates a NexusConnection object with the specified host name and port number.

The newly-created NexusConnection is initially not connected to the specified host. You must call rbxNexusConnection_connect() to establish the connection.

Note:
Unless you have a particular need to specify a port number, use rbxNexway_createNexusConnection() instead of this function.
Parameters:
hostName host name; may be an IP address, a host name, or 'localhost'
port the TCP/IP port that the Nexus is listening on
nexusHandle pointer to an int that receives a handle to the new, un-connected NexusConnection object
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexway_removeNexusConnection (  int  nexusHandle  ) 
 

Disconnects and removes the specified NexusConnection from the list of known NexusConnections.

Parameters:
nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection to be removed
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexway_getNexusConnectionCount (  int *  count  ) 
 

Gets the number of NexusConnection objects in the NexusConnection list.

Parameters:
[out] count pointer to an int that receives the NexusConnection count
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes
Since:
1.0.0

int rbxNexway_getNexusConnection (  int  index,
int *  nexusHandle
) 
 

Gets a handle to the NexusConnection at the specified index in the NexusConnection List.

Note that a NexusConnection's index may change at any time due to other NexusConnections being created/removed.

This method, in conjunction with rbxNexway_getNexusConnectionListMod(), can be used to iterate through all existing NexusConnections.

Parameters:
[in] index the NexusConnection index (zero-based)
[out] nexusHandle pointer to an int that receives the NexusConnection handle;
receives zero if the NexusConnection was not found
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes
Since:
1.0.0

int rbxNexway_getNexusConnectionListMod (  int *  mod  ) 
 

Returns the modification number for the NexusConnection list.

This number is incremented whenever a NexusConnection is created or removed.

This function is typically used to determine if any new NexusConnections have been created or any existing NexusConnections have been removed.

Parameters:
[out] mod pointer to an int that receives the mod
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes
Since:
1.0.0

int rbxNexway_getUsborByName (  char *  usborName,
int *  usborHandle
) 
 

This convenience method searches all known NexusConnections for an Usbor with the specified name.

If the Usbor is found, usborHandle receives the Usbor's non-zero handle. Otherwise, usborHandle receives the value zero.

Parameters:
usborName the name of the Usbor to search for
usborHandle pointer to an int that receives the Usbor handle;
receives zero if the Usbor was not found
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexway_getUsborBySerial (  const char *  serialNum,
int *  usborHandle
) 
 

This convenience method searches all known NexusConnections for an Usbor with the specified serial number.

If the Usbor is found, usborHandle receives the Usbor's non-zero handle. Otherwise, usborHandle receives the value zero.

Parameters:
[in] serialNum the serial number of the Usbor to search for
[out] usborHandle pointer to an int that receives the Usbor handle;
receives zero if the Usbor was not found
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexway_getVersion (  char *  nexwayVer,
int  maxLen,
int *  retLen
) 
 

Gets the version of the Java class com.robix.nexway.Nexway which is being used by the library.

Parameters:
[out] nexwayVer pointer to buffer to receive version
[in] maxLen maximum number of characters to write to buffer
[out] retLen pointer to int to receive number of characters actually written
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes
